src_text: Merero ya ga Jaana1.
trg_text: Messages1.

src_text: Tshomarelo ya Metsi
trg_text: Water security

src_text: Kabibete e lebogile Maaforika Borwa jaaka ba ikobetse dikgato tsa go somarela metsi tse di tsentsweng tirisong mo dikarolong tse di rileng tsa Johannesburg, Tshwane le Ekurhuleni go dira bonnete jwa gore matamo a metsi ga a kgal Metsi mo matamong le mo madutelong a metsi a tswelela go dirisiwa ka bontsi ka ntlha ya dithemphereit ha tse di kwa godimo go ralala Gauteng, mme tiriso eno ya metsi e e kwa godimo e bakile gore Rand Water e fokotse thata metsi a e a tlamelang bommasepalen Setheo se sa tlamelo ya metsi se tlamela ka metsi a mantsi go batho ba feta dimilione tse 11 mo Gauteng le mo dikarolong tsa Mpumalanga, Foreisetata le Bokone Bophirim
trg_text: Cabinet thanked South Africans for adhering to water restrictions implemented in certain parts of Johannesburg, Tshwane and Ekurhuleni to stabilise the capacity of reservoir Dams and reservoirs remain under pressure due to high temperatures in Gauteng, and increasing demand forced Rand Water to reduce water supply to municipalities drasticall The water utility supplies bulk potable water to more than 11 million people in Gauteng, parts of Mpumalanga, the Free State and North Wes

src_text: Maikaelelo a dikgato tseno tsa go somarela metsi, tse go seng tsela epe e re ka di tilang ka yona, ke go dira bonnete jwa gore re nne le metsi a a sa kgaleng mme re tla tswelela go ikobela tsona go fitlha maemo a tokafal Kabinete e ikuetse go baagi go tswelela go ikobela dikgato tsa go somarela metsi le go nna le seabe mo go diriseng metsi ka tshomarel 2.
trg_text: These unavoidable restrictions aim to secure water supply and will remain in place until the situation improve Cabinet called on the public to continue adhering to the water restrictions and play their part by using this scarce resource sparingly

src_text: Go Ngala Ditiro kwa Transnet
trg_text: Infrastructure investment

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse tumelano ya meputso e go dumelanweng ka yona ya dingwaga tse tharo magareng ga Transnet le United National Transport Union (UNTU), e e tsenang tirisong go tloga ka la bo 1 Moranang 2022 go fitlha ka la bo 31 Mopitlwe 2025.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the three-year wage deal reached between Transnet and the United National Transport Union (UNTU), which is applicable for the period 1 April 2022 to 31 March 2025.

src_text: Khomi ene ya Thuanyo, Tsereganyo le Katlholelo e tseregantse mo tumelanong e, e e tlisitseng boipelaetso ba ditokololo tsa UNTU kwa bokhutlong ka gangw Kabinete e amogetse gape tshwetso ya South African Transport and Allied Workers Union ya go fedisa go ngala ditir
trg_text: The Commission for Conciliation, Mediation and Arbitration mediated this deal, which ended the current industrial action by members of UNTU with immediate effec Cabinet also welcomed the decision by the South African Transport and Allied Workers Union to call off the strik

src_text: Kabinete e leboga boineelo jo bo dirilweng ke Transnet mabapi le go tsepamisa mogopolo mo tirong e e saletseng kwa morago mo ditirelong tsa go rwala dithoto ka dikepe le diterene e e bakilweng ke go ngala ditiro, e leng se se amileng ikonomi le makala a a ikaegileng ka ditirelo tse ka tsela e e sa itumedisen
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the commitment by Transnet to focus on clearing backlogs that occurred across the port and rail system during the industrial action, which negatively impacted the economy and sectors that are dependent on its service

src_text: Kabinete e lebogile tshegetso le tirisanommogo e e neetsweng ke lekala la kgwebo mo pakeng e ya go ngala ditir Tshegetso eno e rotloetsa kamano e e tswelelang magareng ga boeteledipele ba Transnet le badiri e leng se se tla tswelang mosola setlamo se le ikonomi ya nag 3.
trg_text: Cabinet noted the concerns raised by the public and resolved to review the Guide for Members of the Executiv This process will be handled by a neutral structure and once completed, the guide will be made public through the Department of Public Service and Administration s website: wwdpsgoz Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP) and JETP Investment Plan (JETP-IP)1

src_text: Dikamano tsa Aforika Borwa
trg_text: Saudi Arabia relations

src_text: Saudi Arabia
trg_text: South Africa

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse Leeto la Tiro le le atlegileng kwa Pusong ya Saudi Arabia ka Moporesitente Cyril Ramaphosa ka la bo 15 le la bo 16 Diphalane 2022.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the successful Working Visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia by President Cyril Ramaphosa on 15 and 16 October 2022.

src_text: Mo leetong le, dinaga tse pedi tse di saenile Dimemorantamo tsa Tirisanommogo (di-MoU) mo makaleng a a farologaneng a a jaaka la temothuo, la bodirelatlhapi, la meepo, la metlakase e e fetlhiwang ka ditsela tse dint hwa, la tshireletso, la dipalangwa le la temothuo ya ditlhagisiwa tsa mo metsin Di-MoU tse dingwe tse di saenilweng di ka ga go tlhongwa ga Lekgotla la Kgwebo ya Motlhakanelwa, tirisano mo diintasetering tsa sesole le theko, gammogo le tirisano mo makaleng a dipatlisiso tsa thutamaj
trg_text: During the visit, the two countries signed 17 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) in various fields such as agriculture, fisheries, mining, renewable energy, security, transport and aquacultur Other MoUs signed are on the establishment of a Joint Business Council, cooperation in the field of military industries and procurements, and on geological survey cooperatio

src_text: Moporesitente o dirisitse leeto le go laletsa dikgwebo tsa Saudi Arabia go tsenela khonferense ya botlhano ya peeletso ya Aforika Borwa e e tla tshwarwang ka 2023.
trg_text: The President used the visit to invite Saudi Arabia businesses to South Africa s fifth investment conference that will be held in 2023.

src_text: Saudi Arabia ke mogwebisani le Aforika Borwa wa maemo a bobedi ka bogolo mo Dinageng tsa Botlhabagare e bile ke lefelo le legolo le dinaga tsa kgaolo eno di rekang mo go lona ditlhagisiw Dikamano tsa bodit haba magareng ga dinaga tsoopedi di nnile le seabe se sentle mo mererong ya kgwebisano le bobeelets 4.
trg_text: Saudi Arabia is South Africa s second largest trading partner in the Middle East and the largest source of imports from the regio International relations between both countries have resulted in a positive effect on trade and investment trends

src_text: Peeletso mo Mafaratlhatlheng
trg_text: Matric Exams

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse go thankgololwa ga polante ya tlhagiso ya maemo a a kwa godimo ka motlhagisi yo o gaisang wa bodit haba, ALPLA Group, kwa Lanseria mo Gauten
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the commissioning of a state-of-the-art plastics production plant by leading international manufacturer, the ALPLA Group, at Lanseria in Gauten

src_text: Se se netefatsa boineelo ba ga Moporesitente Ramaphosa ba go tlhoma tlhabololo ya mafaratlhatlha jaaka tsela e e ka tsosang ikonomi le go oketsa ditir
trg_text: This augments President Ramaphosa s commitment to position infrastructure development as a means to stimulate the economy and increase employmen

src_text: Peeletso ya bokana ka didolara tse dimilione tse 50 ke seabe sa botlhokwa mo leaning le legolong la Toropokgolo ya Ditirodintsi ya Lanseria e e tla kgweetsang tswelelo le tirisogape gammogo le go tlhola le go boloka ditiro tse 350.
trg_text: The investment worth US$50 million is a key contribution to the Lanseria Smart City masterplan that will drive sustainability and recycling as well as create and sustain 350 job Included is an apprenticeship programme for 36 mechatronics and recycling technicians for ALPLA Group operations across southern Afric The apprentice programme will commence in 2023, with the first 12 South African apprentices coming from local communities

src_text: Mo go yona go akarediwa lenaneo la go ithutela tiro la baithutela mekhateroniki ba le 36 le borathekeniki ba tirisogape ba ditirelo tsa ALPLA go ralala borwa jwa Aforik Lenaneo la go ithutela tiro le tla simolola ka 2023, mme baithutela tiro ba ntlha ba le 12 ba Aforika Borwa ba tla bo ba tswa mo mafelong a selega 5.
trg_text: The Department of Public Service and Administration, in partnership with the National Planning Commission and the University of KwaZulu-Natal School of Development Studies, will host the NDP and State Capacity Conference from 7 to 9 November 2022 at Howard College Campus, University of KwaZulu-Nata

src_text: Ditiragalo tsa Meepo tse di seng mo Molaong
trg_text: Illegal mining

src_text: Ditiragalo tsa meepo tse di seng mo molaong di phuaganya metse mo set habeng sa borona mmogo le ikonomi ya rona, le go baka tatlhegelo ya lotseno go bobedi puso le lekala la meep
trg_text: Illegal mining hurts communities and our economy, and results in a loss of revenue for both government and the mining secto

src_text: Kabinete e itumedisitswe ke go amogiwa moselesele wa ditlhobolo le go tshwarwa ga babelaelwa ba le 20 ba ba golaganngwang le ditiragalo tsa meepo tse di seng mo molaong ka nako ya letsholo le le neng la dirwa kwa
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the seizure of a firearms cache and the arrest of 20 suspects linked to illegal mining during an operation at a mineshaft in Stilfontein in North Wes

src_text: afoteng ya moepo wa Stilfontein kwa Bokone Bophirim
trg_text: Fifth Presidential Imbizo to the Northern Cape

src_text: Kabinete e ikuela go Maaforika Borwa go tswelela go dirisana le ditheo tsa molao go dira bonnete jwa gore matsholo a thibelo ya bosenyi a isago le ona a atleg Se se tla romela molaetsa o o bogale wa gore bosenyi ga bo duele, le gore disenyi di tla tshwarwa le go sekisiswa ntle le poifo kgotsa kgetholol 6.
trg_text: Cabinet appeals to South Africans to continue working with law-enforcement agencies to ensure the success of future anti-crime operation This will send a strong message that crime does not pay, and that criminals will be arrested and prosecuted without fear or favou 6.

src_text: Motlakase
trg_text: Energy

src_text: Go sale gale Eskom e saenile ditumelano tsa kadimo tsa dingwaga tse 30 le babeeletsi ba bafetlhi ba ba ba ikemetseng ba motlakase ba le bane go aga mothamo o mo wa wa go fetlhiwa ga motlakase o o phepa kwa ditei eneng tsa motlakase tsa Majuba le Tutuka kwa Mpumalang Dikadimo tse tsa lefatshe di tla ngoka peeletso e e lekanyediwang go diranta di le dibilione tse 40.
trg_text: Eskom recently signed 30-year lease agreements with four independent power producer investors to construct new clean-energy generation capacity at Majuba and Tutuka power stations in Mpumalang The land leases will attract an estimated investment of about R40 billio

src_text: Babeeletsi ba bane ba - HDF Energy South Africa, Red Rocket SA, Sola Group le
trg_text: HDF Energy South Africa, Red Rocket SA, Sola Group and Mainstream Renewable Power Developments South Africa

src_text: Mainstream Renewable Power Developments South Africa
trg_text: capacity to process locally grown produc

src_text: ba tla tsenya bonnye dimekawate di le 2 000 mo mafaratlhatlheng a motlakase a boset hab
trg_text: will contribute at least 2 000 megawatts to the national electricity gri

src_text: Mothamo o mo wa o wa go fetlhwa ga motlakase o solofelwa go golaganngwa mo mafaratlhatlheng a motlakase mo dikgweding tse 24 go ya go 36 go tloga ka konosetso ya tsa matlole, go ikaegilwe ka ditetlelelo tsa tikologo, tlhaolo ya lefatshe le tse dingwe tsa taol 7.
trg_text: The new generation capacity is expected to be connected to the grid within 24 to 36 months from financial closure, subject to environmental, land zoning and other regulatory approvals

src_text: Dikgato tsa go Dira Bonnete jwa gore Naga ga e Tlhaele Dijo
trg_text: Food security

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse gore Kopano ya Agri SA ya 2022 e tshwarelwe kwa Pretoria ka la bo 13 le la bo 14 Diphalane 2022 ka fa tlase ga setlhogo:
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the hosting of the Agri SA Congress 2022 in Pretoria on 13 and 14 October 2022 under the theme:

src_text: Re Kotula seo re se Jetseng ka fa Nageng .
trg_text: The second summit will be used to take stock of the progress made in the implementation of the National Strategic Plan on GBV It will be hosted under the theme:

src_text: Kopano e e ne e buisanela merero e e jaaka go dira gore maanomagolo a temothuo a direle balemi ba naga; mafaratlhatlha a a boikanyego a tlhagiso ya dijo ya selegae go isa isagong, le go matlafatsa bokgoni ba batlhagisi ba dijo go dira ka ditlhagiswa tse di jetsweng mon
trg_text: The congress engaged on issues such as making agriculture masterplans work for local growers; sustainable infrastructure for locally grown food; making the local environment sustainable for local food production into the future, and strengthening food producers

src_text: Mo dikgatong tse dingwe gape tsa go dira bonnete jwa gore naga ga e tlhaele dijo, Kabinete e amogetse gape go thankgololwa ga Sefala sa Boset haba sa Tshireletso ya Dimela le Diphologolo, ke Lenaneo la Semphato sa Itlhamelo mo go tsa Temothuo le Ikonomi ya Dimela le Diphologolo sa Lefapha la Saense le Boitlhamelo, ka tirisano le Yunibesithi ya Pretori Sefala se se tla tshegetsa thibelo, phokotso le taolo ya malwetse a dimela le diphologolo, e leng se se tla oketsang tlhagiso, tshireletso ya dijo le tlhabololo e e tsepameng ya metsemaga
trg_text: In further prioritising food security, Cabinet also welcomed the launch of the National Biosecurity Hub, by the Department of Science and Innovation's Agricultural Bio-economy Innovation Partnership Programme, in collaboration with the University of Pretori The hub will support the prevention, reduction and management of crop and animal disease, which will contribute to increased productivity, food security and sustainable rural developmen

src_text: Ditshwetso tsa Kabinete1.
trg_text: Cabinet decisions1.

src_text: Mametlelelo ya T hata ya Tsamaiso e e seng ya Bogareng ya Mokgatlo wa Tirisano ya Aforika (AU)
trg_text: Ratification of the Decentralisation Charter of the African Union (AU)

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse go romelwa kwa Palamenteng ga T hata ya AU ka ga Meono le Melawana ya Tsamaiso e e Seng ya Bogareng, Bobusi ba Selegae le Tlhabololo ya Selegae gore e mametlelelw Aforika Borwa e saenile T hata e ka Phatwe 2021.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament the AU Charter on the Values and Principles of Decentralisation, Local Governance and Local Development for ratificatio South Africa signed the charter in August 2022.

src_text: T hata ya Tsamaiso e e seng ya Bogareng e tlamela letlhomeso go dinaga tsotlhe tse e leng ditokololo setlankana sa kaedi ka ga tsamaiso e e seng ya bogareng ya dithata le ditiro go tswa go puso ya bose haba go ya go makala a mangwe a pus T hata e samagana bogolo le tsamaiso e e seng ya bogareng ya thata le ditiro, letlhomeso la bobusi ba selegae le tlhabololo ya selega 2.
trg_text: The Decentralisation Charter provides a framework to all member states a guiding document on the decentralisation of powers and functions from national to other spheres of governmen The charter deals largely with the decentralisation of authority and functions, local governance framework and local development

src_text: Lekgotla la Bodit haba la Ngwaga le Ngwaga la bo 32 la Pabalesego mo Diporong (IRSC)
trg_text: 32nd Annual International Railway Safety Council (IRSC)

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse go tshwarwa ga Kopano ya Ngwaga le Ngwaga ya bo 32 ya IRSC kwa Johannesburg go tloga ka 1 go fitlha ka 6 Diphalane 2023 ka fa tlase ga setlhogo:
trg_text: Cabinet approved the hosting of the 32nd Annual IRSC Meeting in Johannesburg from 1 to 6 October 2023 under the theme:

src_text: Popose wa ya diporo mo Lefatsheng le le sa tlhomamisegeng .
trg_text: Reshaping railways in an uncertain World .

src_text: RSC ke kopano sa bodit haba e e kopanyang dirutegi mo mererong ya pabalesego ya diporo go ralala lefatshe go abelana maitemogelo a bona ka maikaelelo a go tokafatsa pabalesego ya dipor
trg_text: The IRSC is an international forum that brings together railway safety professionals from all over the world to exchange experiences so as to improve railway safet

src_text: Jaaka tokololo ya IRSC, Molaodi wa Taolo ya Diporo wa Aforika Borwa o nnile moamogelabaeng wa kopano la bofelo ka 2015.
trg_text: As a member of the IRSC, South Africa s Railway Safety Regulator last hosted this forum in 201

src_text: Seralwa sa Leano la Mafaratlhatlha a Boset haba la 2050 (NIP 2050) Kgato ya bo 2
trg_text: Draft National Infrastructure Plan 2050 (NIP 2050) Phase 2

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse go phasaladiwa ga seralwa sa NIP 2050 Kgato ya bo 2 go ngoka ditshwaelo tsa baag Leano le le neelana ka tsela ya go matlafatsa le go tlaleletsa diporojeke tsa puso tse di golaganen
trg_text: Cabinet approved the gazetting of the draft NIP 2050 Phase 2 for public consultatio

src_text: Le tlhagisa diporojeke tsa botlhokwa tsa mafelobonno a batho; motlakase wa bommasepala; metsi; matlakala a a popota; dipalangwa; mafaratlhatlha a thuto le boitekanelo; mafaratlhatlha a dijithale, le bosenyi le bobod
trg_text: It identifies the strategic projects in human settlements; municipal electricity; water; solid waste; passenger transport; education and health infrastructure; digital infrastructure, and crime and corruptio

src_text: Popego ya leano le e tlamela ka ponelopele ya karolo e e tshwanetseng go lejwa, e tlamela ka tshekatsheko ya maemo a ga jaana, e tlhalosa dipeelo tse di botlhokwa go netefatsa katlego le go tlhalosa tse di tshwanetseng go dirwa go fitlhelela ponelopele e E tshitshinya tsela ya tsenyotirisong e e tshwanetseng go dirwa mo pakeng ya dingwaga tse tharo tsa leanotir 4.
trg_text: The format of the plan provides a vision of the area to be tackled, offers an assessment of the current status, outlines the essential conditions for success and states what needs to be done to achieve the visio It proposes the implementation process to be taken over the three-year running cycle action plan

src_text: Letlhomeso la Boset haba la Tsenyotirisong la go Dira Bodiredipuso ba Porofe enale
trg_text: National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Service

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse Letlhomeso la Boset haba la Tsenyotirisong la go Dira Bodiredipuso ba Porofe enal Letlhomeso le le phasaladitswe ka 2021 go ngoka ditshwaelo tsa baag
trg_text: Cabinet approved the National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Servic The framework was published for public consultation in 2021.

src_text: Letlhomeso le le tlamela ka dipilara tse tlhano tsa ditsereganyo mo go direng Bodiredipuso ba porofe enal Dipilara tse di akaretsa go ngoka le tlhaolo ya pele ga go tsena mo Bodiredipusong; peodinakong le tshimololo; thulaganyo le taolo ya tiragatso; thuto e e tswelelang le tlhabololo ya porofe enale; le tlhatlogo ka maemo mo tirong le ditiragalo mo tiron 5.
trg_text: The framework provides five pillars on interventions in professionalising the Public Servic The pillars include pre-entry recruitment and selection within the Public Service; induction and onboarding; planning and performance management; continuous learning and professional development, and career progression and career incidents

src_text: Diphetogo mo Dipeelong tsa Tiro tsa Bakaedikakaretso (bo DG)
trg_text: Changes in the conditions of employment for Directors-General (DGs)

src_text: Kabinete a amogetse pegelo e e tshitshinyang mekgwa ya go matlafatsa nonofo le bokgoni ba bo DG mo Bodiredipuson Pegelo e e dirile ditshitshinyo di le mmalwa, go akaretsa paka ya tiro ya bo DG le taolo ya maatlatiro ka Bothati ba Khuduthamaga go bantlhankedi ba ba rweleng maikarabel
trg_text: Cabinet approved the report that proposes measures to strengthen the capacity and capability of the DGs in the Public Servic The report made several proposals,

src_text: Pegelo e e tshitshintse gape gore DG mo Kantorong ya Moporesitente o tla tsewa gape e le Tlhogo ya Botsamaisi ba Pus Mo diporofenseng, tiro e e tla newa b oDG ba ba mo dikantorong tsa Ditonakgol Pegelo e e tshitshintse gape mekgwa ya go kaela mafapha ka ga taolo ya dikonteraka tsa bo D
trg_text: The report also proposed that the DG in The Presidency will be designated as the Head of Public Administratio In the provinces, this function will be designated to the DGs in the offices of the Premier The report further proposed measures to guide departments on the management of contracts of DG

src_text: Tsamaiso ya Taolo ya Tiragatso e nt hwa ya bo DG e a tlhabololwa go e nyalanya le diphetogo tse di dumeletswen
trg_text: The revised Performance Management System for DGs is being revised to align it with the approved change

src_text: Tona ya Nama-o-Tshwere ya Bodiredipuso le Botsamaisi, Rre Thulas Nxesi o tla bitsa kopano ya bobegakgang mo bekeng e e tlang go tlhalosa Letlhomeso la Boset haba la Tsenyotirisong la go Dira Bodiredipuso ba Porofe enale le go tlhagisa gape le diphetogo tse di letleletsweng mo dipeelong tsa tiro ya bo D 6.
trg_text: The Acting Minister of Public Service and Administration, Mr Thulas Nxesi, will next week convene a media briefing to outline the National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Service and also unpack the approved changes in the conditions of employment for DGs

src_text: Pegelo ya Botlhano ya Tswelopele mo Tsenyotirisong ya Lekwalopuso la Mabudusatsela ka ga Ditshwanelo tsa Batho ba ba nang le Bogole (WPRPD) ya 2020-2021
trg_text: Hosting of the Presidential Gender-Based Violence and Femicide (GBVF) Summit 2022

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse Pegelo ya Botlhano ya Tswelopele mo Tsenyotirisong ya WPRPD, e e tlhagisang peodinakong ka go tsenngwa tirisong ga WPRP Pegelo e e akaretsa ditshitshinyo go tswa go mafapha a puso a boset haba le a diporofens E tlamela ka peodinakong ka ga tsenyotiriosong ya pholisi e e akaretsang kabo ya matlol
trg_text: Fifth Progress Report on the Implementation of the White Paper on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (WPRPD) 2020-2021 Cabinet approved the Fifth Progress Report on the Implementation of the WPRPD, which provides an update on the implementation of the WPRP The report covers inputs from national and provincial government department It provides updates on the policy implementation that include budget allocation

src_text: Pegelongwaga ya ntlha ya tswelopele e phasaladitswe ka 2017.
trg_text: The first annual progress report was published in 2017.

src_text: Pegelo ya Tswelopele e ya botlhano e letleletswe go phasaladiwa ka kuranta ya puso ke Lefapha la Basadi, Ba wa le Batho ba ba nang le Bogol
trg_text: This fifth progress report has been approved to be gazetted and published by the Department of Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities

src_text: Tokafatso ya Athikele 20(1) ya Tumelano ka ga go Fedisiwa ga Mefuta yotlhe ya Kgethololo Kgatlhanong le Basadi (CEDAW)
trg_text: Amendment to Article 20(1) of the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW)

src_text: Kabinete e dumeletse go romelwa kwa Palamenteng ga tokafatso ya Athikele 20(1) ya CEDAW gore e mametlelelw Diphetogo tse di tlamela ka paka e e okeditsweng ya dikopano tsa komiti e e sekasekang dipegelo tsa dinaga tse e leng ditokolol
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the amendment to Article 20(1) of the CEDAW for ratificatio The amendments provide for an increased duration of the committee meetings that process the member states

src_text: Aforika Borwa e saenile tumelano e ka 1993 le go e mametlelela ka Sedimonthole 1995.
trg_text: South Africa signed this convention in 1993 and subsequently ratified it in December 1995.

src_text: Go romelwa kwa Palamenteng go senka go golaganya tumelano e e mametleletsweng mo malobeng le tokafatso ya Athikele 20(1) ya tumelano
trg_text: The submission to Parliament seeks to align the previously ratified convention with the amendment to Article 20(1) of the convention

src_text: Tumelano ya Dinaga tsa Lefatshe ka ga Kamogelo ya Makwalothuto Tebang le Thuto e Kgolwane
trg_text: Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse go romelwa kwa Palamenteng ga Tumelano ya Dinaga tsa Lefatshe ka ga Kamogelo ya Makwalothuto tebang le Thuto e Kgolwane gore e tsenngwe molaong semmus Fa e sena go tsenngwa molaong semmuso e tla romelwa go Mokgatlo wa Thuto, Saenthifiki le Setso wa Dit habakopano (UN) le mono gae e tla nna karolo ya Molao wa Leano la go Tsamaisa Tiro la Naga la Makwalothuto wa ngwaga wa 2008 (Molao wa bo 67 wa 2008).
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education for ratificatio Once ratified it will be deposited to the United Nations (UN) Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization and domestically enabled through the National Qualifications Framework Act, 2008 (Act 67 of 2008).

src_text: Tumelano eno ya Dinaga tsa Lefatshe e tlhoma melawana ya lefatshe ka bophara ya Kamogelo ya makwalothuto a ditheo tsa thuto e kgolwane le makwalothuto a mangwe ka go dira gore lefatshe ka bophara go se nne le makwalothotu a a sa tseeweng tsiya, a a nang le lehunelo, le a a sa tlhaolwen Tumelano eno e neela tetla ya gore makwalothuto a dinaga disele mo dinageng tse 193 tse e leng ditokololo tsa UN a amogelwe ke dinaga tsen 9.
trg_text: The Global Convention establishes universal principles for fair, transparent and non-discriminatory recognition of higher education qualifications and qualification It allows for the recognition of foreign qualifications in 193 UN member states

src_text: Kgogelomorago ya Ditokafatso mo Kaeding ya Maloko a Khuduthamaga
trg_text: Withdrawal of the amendments to the Guide for Members of the Executive

src_text: Kabinete e tlhomamisitse pegelo e e dirilweng ke Kantoro ya ga Moporesitente ka Mosupologo, 17 Diphalane 2022 go gogela morago diphetogo tse di dirilweng tsa 2022 mo Kaeding ya Maloko a Khuduthamaga, e e bidiwang gape Bukana ya Diton
trg_text: Cabinet endorsed the announcement made by The Presidency on Monday, 17 October 2022 to withdraw the amendments made to the Guide for Members of the Executive, also called the Ministerial Handbook, for 2022.

src_text: Ditokafatso tse di dirilweng ka Moranang 2022 di tlamela ka mothamo o o okeditsweng mo dikantorong tse dingwe tsa Ditona tse di nang le maikarabelo a makala a feta bongw
trg_text: The amendments that were made in April 2022 provided for additional capacity to some of the offices of the Ministers who are responsible for more than one portfoli They also required the State to take over full responsibility for the costs associated with the provision of electricity and water to official residences occupied by members of the executiv

trg_text: After welcoming a presentation on the JETP and the JETP-IP, Cabinet endorsed the JETP-IP and expressed its appreciation of the detailed work undertaken to develop i 1

src_text: JETP-IP e tlhalosa dipeeletso tse di tlhokegang go fitlhelela boineelo ba Puso ya Aforika Borwa ba go fedisa khabone le go tsweletsa kgolo e e tswelelang, le go netefatsa phetogo e e lolameng go badiri le mafelo a a amegan 1
trg_text: The JETP-IP outlines the investments required to achieve the decarbonisation commitments made by the Government of South Africa while promoting sustainable development, and ensuring a just transition for affected workers and communitie 1

src_text: Molaotlhomo wa Thomelo ya Dithoto ka Dikepe wa 2022
trg_text: Merchant Shipping Bill of 2022

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse go romelwa ga Molaotlhomo wa Thomelo ya Dithoto ka Dikepe wa 2022 kwa Palamenteng go diragadiw Molaotlhomo o o tlhabolola Molao wa Thomelo ya Dithoto ka Dikepe, 1957 (Molao 57 wa 1951) o o setseng o le dingwaga di le 70.
trg_text: Cabinet has approved the submission of the Merchant Shipping Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processin The Bill overhauls the 70-year-old Merchant Shipping Act, 1951 (Act 57 of 1951).

src_text: Fa o sena go amogelwa jaaka molao, Molaotlhomo o o tla tlamela ka letlhomeso la semolao go laola tsamaiso ya boleng ya dikep Gareng ga tse dingwe, o tla laola popego, kwadiso, maina le go fedisiwa ga dikep
trg_text: value chai It will regulate amongst others the designing, registration, naming and scrapping of ship

src_text: Diphetogo tse di tla nna le seabe mo go tsosoloseng lekala la tsamaiso ya dithoto ka dikepe gammogo le go nyalanya naga le Tumelano ya Mokgatlo wa Bodit haba wa Pharakano ya Dikep Aforika Borwa e mametleletse tumelano
trg_text: These changes will contribute towards reviving the maritime transport sector and also aligning the country with the International Maritime Organisation Conventio South Africa has ratified this conventio

src_text: Molaotlhomo wa Tokafatso ya Dipalopalo wa 2020
trg_text: Statistics Amendment Bill of 2020

src_text: Kabinete e amogetse go romelwa kwa Palamenteng ga Molaotlhomo wa Tokafatso ya Dipalopalo wa 2022 gore o tswelediw Molaotlhomo o o tshitshinya tokafatso ya Molao wa Ditlhopho, 1999 (Molao 6 wa 1999).
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Statistics Amendment Bill of 2022 for further processin The Bill proposes the amendment to the Statistics Act, 1999 (Act 6 of 1999).

src_text: Diphetogo di tlamela ka tlhabololo le tsenyotirisong ya Tsamaiso ya Boset haba ya Dipalopalo e e tshegetsang ditshwetso tse di tshegediwang ke bopak
trg_text: The amendments provide for the development and implementation of the National Statistics System that supports evidence-based decision

src_text: Samiti ya Moporesitente ya Dikgwebopotlana, tse Dinnye le tse di Magareng (SMME) le Dikoporasi
trg_text: National Presidential Small, Micro and Medium Enterprises (SMME) and Cooperatives Summit

src_text: Lefapha la Tlhabololo ya Dikgwebopotlana, ka tirisano le bannaleseabe ba lekala la poraefete, le tla tshwara Samiti ya SMME le Dikoporasi ya Moporesitente ya Boset haba kwa Bryanston, Gauteng ka 13 go fitlha ka 15 Ngwanatsele 2022.
trg_text: The Department of Small Business Development, in partnership with private-sector stakeholders, will host the National Presidential SMME and Cooperatives Summit in Bryanston, Gauteng from 13 to 15 November 2022.

src_text: Samiti e e tla kopanya bannaleseabe ba botlhokwa ba lekala la poraefete le la puso mo tikologong ya dikgwebopotlana go rerisana ka go senka ditsela tsa go dirisana mmogo go matlafatsa lekala l Bannaleseabe ba ba solofelwang ba akaretsa mekgatlo ya kgwebo, badiri ba diSMME, dirutegi, badiri ba dipholisi le ditheo tsa tlhabololo ya matlol
trg_text: The DDM Presidential Imbizo will assess service-delivery progress and challenges in the Northern Cape and intervene to resolve the The DDM ensures that service-delivery planning, implementation and budgeting are integrated to enhance service delivery to communitie

src_text: Samiti e tla rerisana gape le ka ga Leanolegolo le le Momaganeng la Boset haba la Tlhabololo ya Dikgwebopotlana, le le tlamelang ka letlhomeso le le botlhokwa go matlafatsa lekala la SMM Samiti e e solofelwa gape go thankgolola Dikabo tsa Boset haba tsa SMME tsa Moporesitente tsa Ngwaga le Ngwag 2.
trg_text: The summit will also discuss the National Integrated Small Enterprise Development Masterplan, which provides a strategic framework to strengthen the SMME secto The summit is also expected to introduce the Annual National Presidential SMME Awards

src_text: Go Tshwarwa ga Samiti ya Moporesitente ya 2022 ya Tirisodikgoka e e Ikaegileng ka Bong le Polao ya Basadi (GBVF)
trg_text: The Fifth District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo in Upington, Northern Cape will take place on Friday, 21 October 2022 at the local Mxolisi Dicky Jacobs Stadiu

src_text: Moporesitente Ramaphosa o tla tshwara Samiti ya bobedi ya Moporesitente ya GBVF kwa Gallagher Convention Centre mo Gauteng ka 1 le 2 Ngwanatsele 2022.
trg_text: President Ramaphosa will host the second Presidential GBVF Summit at the Gallagher Convention Centre in Gauteng on 1 and 2 November 2022.

src_text: Samiti ya ntlha e e neng e tshwerwe ka 2018 e ne ya dirisiwa go supa boineelo gape ba puso le balekane ba loago mo go fediseng ditiragalo tse di kwa godimo tsa tirisodikgoka kgatlhanong le basadi mo nagen
trg_text: The first summit held in 2018 was used to recommit government and social partners to ending the high incidents of violence against women in the countr

src_text: Samiti ya bobedi e tla dirisiwa go lekola Tswelopele e e dirilweng mo go tsenngweng tirisong ga Togamaano ya Boset haba ka ga GBV E tla tshwarwa ka fa tlase ga setlhogo:
trg_text: The conference will reflect on state capacity and performance in the first 10 years of the NDP, and will be held under the theme:

src_text: Boikarabelo; Itlhaganediso le Kgodiso JAANONG .
trg_text: Accountability; Acceleration and Amplification NOW .

src_text: Samiti e e tla sekaseka gareng ga tse dingwe, go batla ditsela tsa go itlhaganedisa dikgato le maikarabelo go tswa go mafapha a botlhokwa le bannaleseabe ba ba akaretsang baagi, lekala la poraefete le mekgatlo ya badir 3.
trg_text: The summit will deliberate on, amongst other issues, finding ways to accelerate actions and accountability from key departments and all the stakeholders that include civil society, the private sector and labou 3.

trg_text: CEO: South African National Roads Agenc

src_text: Pitso ya Botlhano ya Mokgwa wa Tlhabololo ya Sedika (DDM) ya ga Moporesitente kwa Upington, Kapa Botlhaba e tla diragala ka Labotlhano, 21 Diphalane 2022 kwa Setediamong sa selegae sa Mxolisi Dicky Jacob
trg_text: President Ramaphosa will hand over the Certificate of Recognition to His Majesty King MisuZulu ka Zwelithini at the Moses Mabhida Stadium in Durban on Saturday, 29 October 2022.

src_text: Pitso ya Moporesitente ya DDM e tla lekola tswelelo ya thebolelo ya ditirelo le dikgwetlho kwa Kapa Botlhaba le go tsereganya go di rarabolol DDM e netefatsa gore thulaganyo, tsenyotirisong le kabelomatlole ya thebolelo ya ditirelo di momagantswe go tokafatsa thebolelo ya ditirelo go baag
trg_text: Cabinet extended its congratulations and well-wishes to: Mr Sam Matekane, the Prime Minister-elect of the Kingdom of Lesoth Cabinet also joined the AU Election Observation Mission to the 7 October 2022 National Assembly Elections in the Kingdom of Lesotho in commending the electoral and political maturity of the People of the Kingdom of Lesotho for conducting the successful election South Africa remains dedicated to strengthening and consolidating bilateral relations as well as enhancing cooperation on regional, continental and global issues of mutual interest

src_text: Puo ya Pholisi ya Maano a go Rulaganyetsa Tiriso ya Matlole mo Pakeng ya Dikgwedi di le Tharo (MTBPS)
trg_text: Medium Term Budget Policy Statement (MTBPS)

src_text: Kabinete e dumela gore MTBPS ya 2022 e e tla alwang ke Tona ya Matlotlo Enoch Godongwana ka Laboraro, 26 Diphalane 2022 ke karolo e e botlhokwa ya tsamaiso e e bulegileng ya Aforika Borwa ya tekanyetsokabo e e maikarabel
trg_text: Cabinet believes that the 2022 MTBPS to be tabled by Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana on Wednesday, 26 October 2022 is an important part of South Africa s open and accountable budgeting proces

src_text: MTBPS e tlhalosa boineelo ba puso mo teng ga maemo a palogotlhe ya tiriso ya matlole e naga e ka e kgonan E tlhalosa gape le gore puso e tla tswala jang mokhino fa gare ga lotseno le ditshenyegelo, le go dirisa matlotlo a a leng teng ka tshwanel
